summary: Kasich claimed to Anderson Cooper during a debate in Milwaukee on March 29th, 2016 that he would be a viable candidate for the nomination because he has been an executive running the seventh-largest state and has seen things happen that would warrant firing someone.

Kasich claimed during the debate in Milwaukee on March 29th, 2016 that his program in Ohio has successfully reduced the number of mentally ill individuals sleeping under bridges or living in prison. He argued that by providing medication and job opportunities, these individuals can become taxpayers and save the state money. Additionally, Kasich stated that treating drug addicts in prisons has resulted in an 80 percent success rate in preventing them from returning to prison, with a recidivism rate of 27 percent.
